items.title: 2025-06-21 16:00 UTC
items.cardTitle: US issues travel warnings and withdraws non-essential personnel
items.cardDetailedText: In the weeks leading up to the hypothetical strike, the U.S. evacuated its citizens, issued travel warnings, and withdrew non-essential personnel from embassies in the region, signaling heightened tensions.

items.title: 2025-06-21 17:00 UTC
items.cardTitle: President announces decision on strike within two weeks (deception)
items.cardDetailedText: As part of a deception plan, the President publicly announced that a decision on striking Iran would be made within two weeks, ostensibly to allow for negotiations, but actually masking the impending attack.

items.title: 2025-06-21 21:00 UTC
items.cardTitle: Decoy B-2 fleet departs Whiteman AFB, flies west over Pacific
items.cardDetailedText: A group of B-2 stealth bombers departed Whiteman Air Force Base in Missouri, flying west towards the Pacific as a decoy. This deception was designed to draw attention and exploit open-source intelligence watchers, obscuring the actual strike package heading eastward.

items.title: 2025-06-21 21:00 UTC
items.cardTitle: Main B-2 strike package departs Whiteman AFB, flies east
items.cardSubtitle: Beginning of the 18-hour flight to Iran
items.cardDetailedText: Seven other B-2s carrying two 'bunker buster' bombs each flew eastward from Whiteman AFB, keeping communications to a minimum to avoid detection. This marked the start of their over 18-hour flight to the target area in Iran.

items.title: 2025-06-22 00:00 UTC
items.cardTitle: Multiple in-flight refuelings over Atlantic and Mediterranean
items.cardDetailedText: Throughout the lengthy journey, the B-2 bombers underwent multiple in-flight refuelings with the aid of prepositioned KC-135 and KC-46A Pegasus aerial refuelers, critical for the 37-hour round trip.

items.title: 2025-06-22 08:00 UTC
items.cardTitle: Decoy B-2 lands in Hawaii due to malfunction

media.name: B-2 Spirit at Joint Base Pearl Harbor-Hickam

items.cardDetailedText: One of the B-2s involved in the decoy mission diverted to Daniel K. Inouye International Airport in Honolulu, Hawaii, due to a malfunction, becoming temporarily stranded.

items.title: 2025-06-22 09:00 UTC
items.cardTitle: US fighters join strike package in CENTCOM area
items.cardDetailedText: Upon entering the U.S. Central Command area, an unspecified number and types of fourth and fifth-generation U.S. fighter jets joined the bombers. These fighters targeted surface-to-air missile sites ahead of the B-2s' approach.

items.title: 2025-06-22 09:40 UTC
items.cardTitle: U.S. submarine launches Tomahawk missiles at Isfahan
items.cardDetailedText: Just prior to the aerial strike package entering Iran, a U.S. submarine in the Central Command Area of Responsibility launched more than two dozen Tomahawk land-attack cruise missiles against the Isfahan nuclear site.

items.title: 2025-06-22 10:10 UTC
items.cardTitle: B-2s drop GBU-57/B 'bunker busters' on Fordow and Natanz
items.cardSubtitle: Main strike on Iran's nuclear facilities
items.cardDetailedText: The lead B-2 dropped two GBU-57 Massive Ordnance Penetrators on the Fordow site. Over the next 25 minutes, a total of 14 MOPs were dropped on targets at Fordow and Natanz. This marked the first operational use of the MOP.

items.title: 2025-06-22 10:35 UTC
items.cardTitle: Strike package exits Iranian airspace safely
items.cardDetailedText: The 'Midnight Hammer' strike package successfully exited Iranian airspace. No shots were fired at the planes, and Iranian air defenses did not detect the stealthy American jets, maintaining the element of surprise throughout the mission.

items.title: 2025-06-22 23:00 UTC
items.cardTitle: B-2 bombers return to Whiteman AFB
items.cardDetailedText: After a continuous 37-hour flight, including striking the targets and multiple in-air refuelings, the B-2 bombers safely returned to their home base at Whiteman Air Force Base, Missouri.

items.title: 2025-06-22 23:30 UTC

media.name: Dan Caine said during a press conference

items.cardDetailedText: Senior Pentagon officials held a press conference, revealing details of 'Operation Midnight Hammer,' confirming the strikes on three Iranian nuclear facilities and emphasizing the mission's success in achieving 'extremely severe damage and destruction' to the targets.
